page.title: 02INDUSTRY in Withington 1
page.content: The quarrying of{sand}provides employment for 160 people in Withington. 70 vehicles of 20/30 ton capacity convey sand mainly outside the area. The biggest customer is Pilkington{Glass}Works Lancashire (50%), Founderies (30%), Potteries, concrete making firms etc. (20%). Only 1% of materials is very course. Six grades are produced and sandwiched between upper and lower levels of red sand is white silica used for glassmaking. Some 800,000 tons is quarried yearly. The latest excavation at Acre Nook West is loaded onto a diesel conveyor belt 1.5 Kilometers long, back to the main works at Dingle Bank for processing. One seam exposed this month(Sept.1985) shows{fossilised} wood, leaves and beetles over 60,000 years old.
